guide.introduction: Have you ever wanted to put un-music files on an MP3 player? Well, I'll show you how today.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Have you ever wanted to put un-music files on an MP3 player? Well, I'll show you how today.

Relevant parts
  • MP3 Player
  • USB cable
  • Computer running Windows XP, Vista, or Mac OS X
  • Files for MP3 Player

parts.text: Computer running Windows XP, Vista, or Mac OS X

lines.text: First, make sure your computer treats your MP3 player as a flash drive by plugging it in.
lines.text_raw: First, make sure your computer treats your MP3 player as a flash drive by plugging it in.

lines.text: When Autoplay pops up, click on Open Folder To View Files. Check to make sure that the MP3 player has a drive letter assigned (Figure B.)
lines.text_raw: When '''Autoplay''' pops up, click on '''Open Folder To View Files'''. Check to make sure that the MP3 player has a drive letter assigned (Figure B.)

lines.text: Now find the file you want to put on your MP3 player. (Figure A.) Then copy and paste the file to the MP3 player. (Figure B.)
lines.text_raw: Now find the file you want to put on your MP3 player. (Figure A.) Then copy and paste the file to the MP3 player. (Figure B.)

lines.text: You are done! To view files on another computer, just plug it in on that computer.
lines.text_raw: You are done! To view files on another computer, just plug it in on that computer.

lines.text: Troubleshooting: Autoplay won't start? What happened? Just go to My Computer and look for the MP3 player there.
lines.text_raw: Troubleshooting: Autoplay won't start? What happened? Just go to '''My Computer''' and look for the MP3 player there.

guide.summary: Here's how to use an MP3 player as a flash drive.
